SEARCH
Package org.boardgames.crossway.controller

Class UiController

java.lang.Object
org.boardgames.crossway.controller.UiController
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameEvents
public class UiController extends Object implements GameEvents
Controller that manages the user interface components of the application.

Responsibilities include setting up the frame, managing the history panel and updating view components when the underlying game changes.

See Also:
  • CrosswayController
  • BoardHistorySplitPane
  • BoardView
  • HistoryView

    • setHistoryMenuItem

      public void setHistoryMenuItem(JMenuItem historyMenuItem)
      Injects the menu item responsible for toggling the history panel.
      Parameters:
      historyMenuItem - the menu item to update when the history visibility changes

    • rebuildAfterGameChange

      public void rebuildAfterGameChange(Game game, Consumer<Point> boardClickHandler)
      Replaces the board with a new one after a game import or restart. This method is responsible for updating all UI components to reflect the new game state.
      Parameters:
      game - The new game instance.
      boardClickHandler - The callback to handle board clicks.

    • updateHistoryDisplay

      public void updateHistoryDisplay(List<Move> history)
      Updates the display of the move history.
      Parameters:
      history - The list of moves to display.

    • refreshHistory

      public void refreshHistory(List<Move> history)
      Refreshes the history view. This method is part of the GameEvents interface.
      Specified by:
      refreshHistory in interface GameEvents
      Parameters:
      history - The list of moves to display.

    • handleShowHistoryRequest

      public void handleShowHistoryRequest()
      Handles a request to show or hide the move history panel. It toggles the visibility, updates the UI, and adjusts the menu item text.

    • getFrame

      public JFrame getFrame()
      Gets the main application frame.

    • showPieDialog

      public boolean showPieDialog()
      Prompts the user to decide whether to swap colors using the pie rule. This method is part of the GameEvents interface.
      Specified by:
      showPieDialog in interface GameEvents
      Returns:
      true if the user chooses to swap, false otherwise.

    • showWinDialog

      public int showWinDialog(Player winner)
      Shows a dialog informing the user that a player has won and returns the user's choice. This method is part of the GameEvents interface.
      Specified by:
      showWinDialog in interface GameEvents
      Parameters:
      winner - The player who won the game.
      Returns:
      An integer representing the chosen action.
